info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cabarrus, southeastern Lincoln, south central Iredell, northwestern Mecklenburg, southwestern Rowan and northeastern Gaston Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ramsey Creek Park, or 4 miles northwest of Huntersville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huntersville, Cornelius, Mooresville, Davidson, Ramsey Creek Park, Lake Norman, and Lowesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
